thread.section_title: Viewers feel sorry for Susanna Reid as Bob Mortimer and Vic Reeves flash ‘fake penis’ during Comic Relief – Metro
thread.title: Viewers feel sorry for Susanna Reid as Bob Mortimer and Vic Reeves flash ‘fake penis’ during Comic Relief
thread.title_full: Viewers feel sorry for Susanna Reid as Bob Mortimer and Vic Reeves flash ‘fake penis’ during Comic Relief

author: Katie Baillie
title: Viewers feel sorry for Susanna Reid as Bob Mortimer and Vic Reeves flash ‘fake penis’ during Comic Relief
text:
Viewers were shocked the penis was shown before 9pm (Picture: Gary Moyes/BBC/PA Wire) Susanna Reid had probably been under the impression it would only be the donation totals that would be rising on Comic Relief.
Stephen Hawking looks for new voice in Comic Relief sketch - Liam Neeson's keen But no, Vic Reeves’ fake penis did to.
The Good Morning Britain presenter took part in a live comedy sketch as part of Comic Relief, which saw her as the subject of the interview for once. But it was an interview like she’d never experienced before, with questions she was most definitely not expecting.
Like when Bob Mortimer asked if when she wakes up in the morning next to Piers Morgan, does he leave a residue on the sheets? And the couple queried what Susanna uses if she’s ever caught without toilet paper, a sock or a £10 note?
But the piece de resistance as far as the audience were concerned was when Vic Reeves got his ‘Kong’ out.
@susannareid100 Hung like a baby's arm.No peeking! pic.twitter.com/HG47a4oe9z 
— Lee (@AberdeenLee) March 25, 2017 

Susanna was forced to cover her face as Vic played on the title of the new movie: ‘Have you seen Kong?
‘It’s out there. It’s quite long, have you seen it? It’s very long and heavy at the end with a twist in the middle and at the beginning there’s a couple of little clackers… it’s quite hairy at the beginning. You’ll probably miss it.’
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Viewers were shocked that his ‘manhood’ made an appearance so early on in the evening too, and by the look on her face, so was Susanna.
Is my clock wrong or does Vic Reeves have his dick out before 9pm #comicrelief 
— Laneeey✌ (@AlsTwittah) March 24, 2017 

Without looking down, Susanna replied: ‘I don’t think I’m missing anything right now.’
Comic relief… painful. Ed Sheeran was told not to use the word rape but the worst comedians I've ever seen can parade a fake penis?
— Imogen Cole (@ImogenCole01) March 24, 2017 

The sketch itself was slammed as being awkward and ‘unfunny’, with viewers sympathising with Suanna for having to sit through it.
@susannareid100 Hope you've recovered from that awful experience last night. #disgusting 
— malcolm jacobus (@maljacqpr) March 25, 2017 
Think @susannareid100 found Reeves & Mortimer as unfunny as I did #RedNoseDay 
— Carl (@ocs9000) March 25, 2017 
@susannareid100 I'm afraid the sketch will be in one of those top 100 most cringe worthy shows show at Xmas. You were great, Vic & Bob awful
— David Clark (@hollyemma22) March 25, 2017 
@susannareid100 I felt so uncomfortable for you during that Vic and Bob sketch tonight. You deserved better. I turned it off. x
— Paul Burton (@paulburton73) March 25, 2017 

But elsewhere the show won a legion of fans.
The Love Actually sketch was met with calls for Hugh Grant to be made P rime Minister after his boogy to Hotline Bling , and Ed Sheeran caught a few giggles when he snogged Greg Davies .
And the charity show managed to drum up a huge amount of support, breaking all kinds of records in raising over £71,000,000 for the cause .
MORE: Comic Relief 2017 breaks records for amount of money donated on the night 
MORE: Ed Sheeran SNOGS Greg Davies on Comic Relief after nearly locking lips with Miranda
